edu.iu.dsc.tws.tset.ops

Class BaseOp

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.iu.dsc.tws.tset.ops.BaseOp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Receptor, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BaseComputeOp, SinkOp, SourceOp

    public abstract class BaseOp
extends java.lang.Object
implements Receptor, java.io.Serializable
    Every tset op is a Receptor. This class handles that. This also takes care of creating/updating TSetContext.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getReceivableNames

        public IONames getReceivableNames()
        Description copied from interface: Receptor
        This method should return a set of receivable names, that are expected by this receptor. These names will be used by task plan builder to cross validate parallelism between two task graphs.

        If Collector C of task graph TG1 collects variable "var1" and C's parallelism is n, If Receptor R of task graph TG2 is interested in receiving "var1", R's parallelism should be equal to n and, R should have the same distribution as C among the workers.

        Specified by:
        getReceivableNames in interface Receptor
        Returns:
        get the set of names
